meanings.sent1: The tree detruded its branches into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The turtle detruded its head from its shell to look around.
meanings.sent3: The cake detruded out of the pan while baking, creating a funny shape.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement detruded from her voice as she spoke about the upcoming trip.
meanings.sent5: The mountain detruded majestically against the horizon, casting a long shadow.

meanings.sent1: He detruded the key into the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The child detruded his tongue in a playful manner.
meanings.sent3: The cat detruded its claws when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent4: The sun detruded its rays through the clouds after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The flower detruded its petals, revealing a vibrant color.

meanings.definition: to extend beyond the usual or proper limits
meanings.sent1: The meeting detruded into the lunch hour due to the lengthy discussion.
meanings.sent2: His speech detruded into personal matters that were not relevant to the topic.
meanings.sent3: The river detruded its banks after heavy rainfall, causing flooding.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter detruded into uncontrollable giggles at the silly joke.
meanings.sent5: The project detruded beyond the deadline, causing delays in the schedule.
